Hemant Singh Sidar is a passionate Full Stack Developer and AI Enthusiast. He specializes in building modern web applications using React, Node.js, Python, and FastAPI. His focus is on creating clean, efficient, and user-friendly software solutions that leverage cutting-edge technologies. 🚀

Hemant is a skilled software engineer who combines expertise in full-stack development with a deep interest in AI/ML technologies. He's dedicated to crafting exceptional digital experiences that blend technical excellence with intuitive design. 💻

Hemant has a diverse skill set in modern web technologies. His core skills include: 
• Frontend: React, JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML5/CSS3
• Backend: Python, Node.js, FastAPI
• Databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB
• AI/ML: TensorFlow, PyTorch
• DevOps: Docker, Git

He's particularly strong in building full-stack applications with AI integration. 🛠️

Hemant's technical expertise spans both frontend and backend development. He's proficient in:
• Web Development: React, JavaScript, Python
• API Development: FastAPI, Node.js
• Database Management: SQL & NoSQL
• AI/ML Development
• Cloud Technologies

He continuously learns and adapts to new technologies. 💡

I have experience working at companies like Google and Microsoft. At Google, I led a team developing cloud-based solutions, and at Microsoft, I worked on the Azure platform. You can find more details in the Resume section.

My professional experience includes roles at Google as a Senior Software Engineer and at Microsoft as a Software Engineer. I've also completed an internship at Facebook. Details about my responsibilities and achievements are available in the Resume section.

I hold a Master of Science in Computer Science from Stanford University and a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from UC Berkeley. My academic focus was on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

I studied Computer Science at Stanford University (Master's) and UC Berkeley (Bachelor's). During my studies, I specialized in AI and Machine Learning and completed a thesis on Deep Learning Applications in NLP.
